Posts.Content: On 10/17/2007 annalittlebit wrote: I was diagnosed with breast cancer in 2003--I underwent surgery for one breast, chemo and radiation. I have been taking arimidex since. Although I try not to dwell on the possibility of recurrance I find that sometimes I worry a great deal about the cancer coming back.  I also think at times that I want to stop arimidex due to the side affects which I live with daily. Does anyone have input to , or share my concerns??  Please respond. I just stumbled upon this website this morning and am hoping it is a good place to be.  Friends who have not shared my experience cannot relate to my feelings on these matters.   Anna, Try to stay positive and enjoy your life. I know it is hard not to immediately think recurrance when any little pain pops up, but most of the time it is not related.  I fought with humor and it served me well.  I had stage II 2.5 cen tumor, neg nodes.  I had lumpectomy, chemo and 35 radiation treatments.  I was on Tamoxifen for 5 yrs.  They tried me on Arimidex, but the side effect I experienced was the feeling of bugs crawling all over my back, and a bad cough, very strange.  I also tried Aromisin and bad side effects there also.  My Oncologist decided no more meds of that nature for me.  (I admit this is a little scary loosing my "crutch") I am living day to day and if the cancer returns I will fight it again just like the first time.  It will not take me down!  FYI for those of you dealing with terrible hot flashes, my Oncologist prescribed Gabapentin and it has been a miracle!  Many doctors have never heard of this drug for hotflashes, but it is truly amazing.  My hotflashes are reduced about 95% and I had SEVERE problems with them.  Best of luck to all!

Posts.Content: Lynn S., I had breast cancer in 2002, I am also taking tamoxifen, but I don't look at it with the same attitude as you. It is not a daily reminder to me of cancer, but more of a preventative that I am more than happy to take if it will keep the cancer from coming back. I don't dwell on what happened to me, I am happy to be alive and moving on with my life. Also I would not like a monthly pill as I would be more likely to forget to take it on time.
Posts.Title: Time-release Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: On 2/15/2007 Suzq53 wrote: Hi. I am five years out, as of Jan 14th. I took tamoxifin for two years, then switched to aromasin. I was told that I would be on these drugs for a total of five years. Now, my doctor tells me that I can stay on Aromosin for five years. I'm concerned that maybe these drugs might be doing harm that we don't know about - but at the same time I want to do all I can to prevent the big C from returning. I have had joint aches, back pain, sadness (on and off), tiredness and just not feeling "good" since going through this cancer experience (chemo, radiation). I'm curious if some of these feelings will go away if I stop taking the aromosin. I don't know what to do -- keep taking it, or stop. Any thoughts? My heart-felt wishes go out to all of you on this message board. Thanks for reading my message and for your thoughs. Hi,  I am 4 yrs out and after taking tamoxifin for 3.5 yrs I was put on Arimidex, bad side effects for me so was changed to Aromasin.  I experienced the same side effects that you are discribing and my Oncologist took me off of that too and back on Tamoxifin (he says for 1 yr).  I feel ten times better than when on Aromasin.  I hope you find the answers you are looking for and hope you are feeling better soon.
Posts.Title: Should I keep taking Aromosin?
